service.name: Claim Tax Benefits
start.banner.1: The Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) sent you a letter about the new
start.banner.2: service. You need information on that letter to file your 2018 taxes with this service.
start.p1: You may be able to use this service if Ontario was your home province on December 31, 2018. Your income for the 2018 tax year must be under $35,000, and:
start.li1: Come from your employment, pension, Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP), or benefits such as social assistance.
start.li2: May include up to $1,000 of interest income. The interest must come from Canadian sources, such as a bank or savings account.
start.li3: Can’t come from your own business or self-employment.
start.li4.1: Personal filing code. You can find this code in the CRA letter about this new

Please enter your RRSP contributions bef: Please enter your RRSP contributions before March 1, 2019.
Your taxes have been filed with the Cana: Your taxes have been filed with the Canada Revenue Agency.
Use this confirmation number if you need: Use this confirmation number if you need to contact CRA for further information or for additional help with your tax return.
Print a summary of your tax return: Print a summary of your tax return
Your Notice of Assessment is an official: Your Notice of Assessment is an official CRA communication that confirms that you’ve filed your taxes. It also contains the details of your refund or balance owing. Please read this document carefully.
Now that your return is filed, you shoul: Now that your return is filed, you should be all set for the year.
However, if you still have further quest: However, if you still have further questions, there are several ways to get help:
Speak to someone at your nearest tax cli: Speak to someone at your nearest tax clinic
find a free tax clinic in your area: find a free tax clinic in your area
Speak to a CRA agent by calling: Speak to a CRA agent by calling

get in contact with the CRA to update yo: get in contact with the CRA to update your information
Once updated, you can proceed to use thi: Once updated, you can proceed to use this service.
You can find the marital status we have: You can find the marital status we have on file below. Click confirm if this is correct or change it. Having your accurate marital status on file is important for you to properly file your taxes and get your benefits.
Please choose the correct status from th: Please choose the correct status from the options listed below.
Please enter the correct mailing address: Please enter the correct mailing address information below. If a letter is sent to this address, you must be able to receive it.
Your taxes can’t be completed using this: Your taxes can’t be completed using this service

Please enter your charitable donations i: Please enter your charitable donations into the fields below.

Your tax return is too complex to be fil: Your tax return is too complex to be filed using this service. Nothing about your taxes is incorrect — see below for further instructions on how to complete your tax return.
To finish filing your taxes for 2018, yo: To finish filing your taxes for 2018, you will need to do one of the following:
Use the paper form enclosed in the Claim: Use the paper form enclosed in the Claim Tax Benefits package you received in the mail

You live in a small or rural community i: You live in a small or rural community if you
live in these areas: Ottawa, Kingston, B: live in these areas: Ottawa, Kingston, Belleville, Peterborough, Oshawa, Toronto, Hamilton, St. Catharines-Niagara, Kitchener-Cambridge-Waterloo, Brantford, Guelph, London, Windsor, Barrie, Sudbury, or Thunder Bay.
You can claim medical expenses for your: You can claim medical expenses for your self, spouse or common-law partner, and dependent children born after 2001.

Eligible medical expenses can include sp: Eligible medical expenses can include specialized equipment, accessibility devices, etc. For more information, please refer to
the CRA's guide to eligible medical expe: the CRA's guide to eligible medical expenses

Without your correct name on file, you c: Without your correct name on file, you can’t file your taxes using this online service. You can still file using the Claim Tax Benefits service – follow the instructions on page X of the paper package we mailed to you.
There are also other free and secure way: There are also other free and secure ways to file your taxes:
This service is only available to reside: This service is only available to residents of Ontario
Since you weren’t a resident of Ontario: Since you weren’t a resident of Ontario on December 31, 2018, you can’t use this service to file your taxes.
The income we have on file does not matc: The income we have on file does not match your records
If your records don’t match the income i: If your records don’t match the income information displayed earlier, or you believe it to be incorrect, you shouldn’t use this service to file your taxes.

Your code has 9-characters and you can f: Your code has 9-characters and you can find it on the CRA letter about the Claim Tax Benefits service. The letter has your name and address at the top.
Your personal filing code was validated!: Your personal filing code was validated!
You can find your SIN on your tax return: You can find your SIN on your tax return or other correspondence from Service Canada. Service Canada also gave you a card or confirmation letter with your SIN.
CRA doesn't need your middle name.
